meanings.definition: A small motorboat used for pleasure cruising.
meanings.sent1: We saw many runabouts on the lake during our vacation.
meanings.sent2: The runabouts glided smoothly across the water, creating ripples.
meanings.sent3: The runabouts seemed to dance on the sparkling lake, like graceful swans.
meanings.sent4: The runabouts were like colorful fish darting through the blue sea.
meanings.sent5: The runabouts hummed softly as they explored the tranquil waters.

meanings.definition: A small, lightweight car used for short trips.
meanings.sent1: My uncle drove a runabouts to the grocery store every day.
meanings.sent2: The runabouts parked neatly in the crowded city streets.
meanings.sent3: The runabouts zipped through traffic like busy bees on a mission.
meanings.sent4: The runabouts were like tiny beetles scurrying along the road.
meanings.sent5: The runabouts purred as they navigated the winding roads with ease.

meanings.definition: A person who runs errands or performs tasks.
meanings.sent1: The runabouts at the office always delivered messages promptly.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the runabouts of the neighborhood, always helping out.
meanings.sent3: The runabouts juggled multiple tasks with a smile, like a skilled circus performer.
meanings.sent4: He was the runabouts of the team, always ready to assist in any way.
meanings.sent5: The runabouts buzzed around the office, ensuring everything was in order.
